title: Subscribe - Baltimore Business Journal
description: The Baltimore Business Journal features local business news about Baltimore. We also provide tools to help businesses grow, network and hire.
content:
When can I cancel? Are refunds available?

If for any reason, at any time you are dissatisfied, you may cancel your annual Premium, Premium Plus, or Premium Elite subscription and receive a refund on all unserved issues, and the amount available for refund is greater than $5.00. To change or cancel your annual subscription, please contact us at (866) 853-3661. Refunds are not available for Premium Unlimited subscriptions.

When can I cancel? Are refunds available?

If for any reason, at any time you are dissatisfied, you may cancel your subscription (terms of 90 days or less), but no refunds will be issued. To change or cancel your subscription, please contact us at (866) 853-3661.

What are your prices?

Prices vary depending on the product and term purchased. Initial terms offer our lowest available prices. Initial subscriptions are available only to new subscribers.

At the end of the initial term, your subscription will automatically renew at the current price for your product.

By what methods can I pay?

All purchases require credit card payment and are automatically renewed.

Will my subscription be automatically renewed?

Yes. All subscriptions will be automatically renewed for your convenience. You won’t have to worry about renewal notices, phone calls or missing issues if you forget to renew. You have complete control over your subscription and can contact us to change or cancel this feature at any time. Prior to each annual renewal, you will be sent a reminder notice stating the term and rate then in effect. If you do nothing, your credit/debit card will be charged at the then current rate. You may cancel the auto-renew feature at any time by calling (866) 853-3661 or filling out this auto-renewal cancellation form. Offer not available to Vermont residents.

How do I renew my subscription without the auto-renewal option?

Sign into your online account and navigate here. If you have questions, please contact us at (866) 853-3661.

What’s the difference between a membership and a premium membership (subscription)?

A membership will provide access to general business news stories published throughout the day. A premium membership is required to access premium content, the Digital Edition, the Book of Lists, and other premium tools and features.

On the Sign In page, enter the email address and password of your premium membership.

What if I have forgotten my password?

If you have forgotten your password, use the link on the Sign In page to recover it. An email will be sent with instructions to reset your password.

If I start a premium membership online, will I receive immediate access to premium content?

Yes. If you use a credit card to start a premium membership online, you will receive immediate online access to premium content and the Digital Edition.

What is the Digital Edition?

The Digital Edition is a complete digital replica of the printed weekly edition. It is viewable online via an e-reader.

How can I view the Digital Edition?

In order to access the Digital Edition, you must have an active subscription and it must be linked to your online account. To access the Digital Edition, click here.

How do I download the PDF version of the Digital Edition?

Only active subscribers can download a PDF of the Digital Edition. PDFs of all weekly issues are available in your account, click here. You can also download a PDF from any Digital Edition. Once you open the Digital Edition, you can choose Archive in the top left corner. This will allow you to download the entire issue.

How do I search the Digital Edition for names of companies or individuals?

Active subscribers can view the Digital Edition and quickly find company or individual names mentioned by clicking the magnifying glass on the bottom right corner of the Digital Edition. Type your keyword, company name or individual name that you would like to find and click the magnifying glass or the Enter key.

How do I get Digital Edition back issues?

Only active subscribers can view Digital Edition back issues. To view the Digital Edition archive, you can click the View Archive Issues link in your online account. You can also click the Archive button when viewing the most recent Digital Edition.

Am I allowed to share the Digital Edition with others?

No. Only active subscribers can view the Digital Edition. The Digital Edition may not be distributed, disseminated or copied for any reason. This is part of our user agreement, and by viewing the Digital Edition or downloading a PDF, you agree to follow the rules spelled out in the user agreement.

Yes. Morning Edition, Afternoon Edition and Breaking News Alert email newsletters are sent at no cost. All memberships include complimentary sends of these email newsletters*.

How do I change my email newsletter preferences?

You can update your account by clicking here.
summary: The Baltimore Business Journal offers a list of information regarding subscription cancellation and refunding policies. Subscriptions can be cancelled at any time due to dissatisfaction, but refunds are not available for Premium Unlimited subscriptions. All subscriptions are automatically renewed at the end of their initial term and renew at the current price for your product. All purchases require credit card payment and are renewed automatically. If you start a premium membership online, you will immediately receive immediate access to premium content. The Digital Edition is a digital replica of the printed weekly edition and is viewable online via an e-reader. The price of each subscription varies depending on the product and term purchased. Subscription prices range from initial terms to initial subscription offers the lowest available prices. The list of subscription terms includes initial subscription terms for new subscribers and initial subscription prices for new ones. The article also includes a detailed explanation of how to view the Digital Edition and how to share the most recent issue with others.
shortSummary: A guide to subscriptions, including annual, Premium Plus, and Premium Elite, and how you can renew or cancel them without charge.
argos_summary: The article explains the cancellation and refund policies for various subscription tiers, noting that annual Premium, Premium Plus, and Premium Elite plans allow refunds for unused issues if cancelled, while Premium Unlimited does not. It also details that all subscriptions auto‑renew unless cancelled, with reminders sent before renewal, and that cancellations can be made by phone or online. Additionally, it outlines payment methods, renewal options, and access to digital content for active subscribers.
